<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/10/disney-world-reopens-cases-spike-florida?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Disney's Looking for That Reopening Magic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Disney World reopening " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjc1L2Rpc25leV93b3JsZF9yZW9wZW5pbmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ROBYN BECK/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve been as guilty as anyone in using the term “New Normal” to describe the resumption of daily life during the pandemic. But you have to admit it <em>is</em> the perfect phrase for today’s <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/09/disney-reopening-this-week-even-as-coronavirus-cases-spike-in-florida.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reopening</a> of Walt Disney World in Orlando. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney World open = normal</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney World open but everyone’s in masks and you can’t hug Mickey = new normal. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom will reopen today, with Epcot and Hollywood Studios set to greet visitors July 15.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Disney is actually </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/08/business/coronavirus-disney-world-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not the first</a></span><span> of the FL parks to come back. SeaWorld is open, and Universal’s three parks opened up June 5 with limited capacity.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney has also reopened four theme parks in Asia.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The Dumbo in the room</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you think it’s an odd time to open up a theme park for thousands of strangers to mingle together, most wouldn’t disagree with you. COVID-19 cases have surged in Florida, where the park is located, and ICU beds are now <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/health/2020/07/09/coronavirus-florida-nearly-half-states-icus-least-90-full/5409773002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at a premium</a>. Health officials say the curve is not flat.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">However, Disney thinks it can open the park in a safe way that protects staff and visitors. Its safety protocols, which have been signed by a union representing roughly 48,000 employees, call for mandatory mask wearing, thousands of hand-sanitation stations, empty seats on rides, <a href="https://disneyparks.disney.go.com/blog/2020/07/disney-parks-commitment-to-health-safety-measures/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">and more</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The financial impact </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For Disney, opening up Disney World isn’t really something it wants rather than <em>needs</em>. The theme park’s contribution to the company’s top line is staggering:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Media analyst Michael Nathanson told CNN Business that Disney World </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/09/media/disney-world-reopening/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">generated</a></span><span> 16% of Disney’s total revenue in 2019—$11.2 billion.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The broader theme parks segment is also an important profit-driver for the company, allowing it to invest in new products that may not make money right away.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those new investments were a life-saver during the pandemic. We’re talking about Disney+, of course, which just enjoyed a <em>Hamilton</em>-sized weekend over the Fourth of July. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Disney World is the sun breathing life into the entire Disney ecosystem. The company is desperate to get it open. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/10/goya-food-faces-boycott-ceo-praises-trump?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
2020: The Year of the Boycott
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Goya boycott is on" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjg5L2dveWFfYm95Y290dF9pc19vbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Supermarket staple Goya Foods is facing loads of backlash and a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2020/07/10/goya-boycott-trump/?utm_campaign=wp_main&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">boycott</a> after its CEO Robert Unanue praised President Trump’s leadership in a joint appearance Thursday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At a ceremony marking the president’s executive order to improve access to educational and economic opportunities for Hispanic Americans, Unanue said, “We’re all truly blessed at the same time to have a leader like President Trump who is a builder, and that’s what my grandfather did.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many didn’t like the sound of a prominent Hispanic executive <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/10/business/goya-foods-boycott-trump/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">applauding</a> a president with extremely aggressive anti-immigrant policies and rhetoric. Former Democratic presidential candidate Julián Castro criticized Unanue for “praising a president who villainizes and maliciously attacks Latinos for political gain.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On Fox News yesterday, Unanue didn’t apologize. He called the boycott “suppression of speech” and explained he’d pick up the phone for the president of the U.S. no matter who it is. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Goya Foods is considered the country’s largest Hispanic-owned food company. It was started by Unanue’s grandfather, a Spanish immigrant, and remains a privately held company.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/10/mets-ownership-drama-heats-cohen-lead?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Would love to, but the line is getting a little long. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The deadline for the first round of bids was due on Thursday, and once again billionaire hedge fund manager Steve Cohen’s name topped the list. On Thursday, Fox Business reported the Point72 founder <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/sports/cohen-bidding-2b-for-mets-franchise-and-2b-for-cable-network-gasparino?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offered $2 billion</a> to the Wilpon family (the current owners) and another $2 billion for SNY, the regional sports network that airs Mets games.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cohen’s bid was smaller than his last attempt to buy the franchise. He offered $2.6 billion earlier this year, but walked away at the last minute.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s his competition? </strong>None other than the punctuation power duo of A-Rod and J.Lo, says the <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/07/09/alex-rodriguez-and-jennifer-lopez-bid-has-proper-funding-to-buy-mets/?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20200710&instance_id=20202&nl=dealbook&regi_id=83342785&segment_id=33088&te=1&user_id=6e8f5c5256f51c870f4df90ca819260d&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NY Post</a>. Worth a paltry $750 million combined, you might not think they’d be able to outbid the guy <em>Billions </em>is literally based on, but the couple is being plugged by, yes, another billionaire investor Vinny Viola. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We should mention Philadelphia 76ers and New Jersey Devils owners Josh Harris and David Blitzer are also reportedly in the mix. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/popcorn_1f37f.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""></strong></p>

AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/10/electric-vehicle-race-heating?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Electric Avenue Is Getting Crowded
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are two more electric vehicle companies that you can casually name drop the next time someone brings up Elon Musk.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Rivian</strong>, the electric vehicle startup backed by Amazon and Ford, raised an additional <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-rivian-funding/tesla-rival-rivian-adds-2-5-billion-investment-led-by-t-rowe-price-idUSKBN24B1UL?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$2.5 billion yesterday</a> in a round led by T. Rowe Price. It already has a deal in place to provide <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/10/rivian-raises-massive-2-5-billion-as-it-pushes-to-bring-its-electric-pickup-suv-to-market/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100,000 delivery vans for Amazon</a> by 2021, but the funds will also support its goal to be the first automaker to bring an all-electric pickup truck to market.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. Fisker</strong>, another young electric automaker, is reportedly in talks to go public via a “<a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-spartan-energy-m-a-fisker/fisker-the-latest-electric-car-maker-eyeing-deal-to-go-public-sources-idUSKBN24A2HZ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blank check acquisition company</a>”—a bit of financial maneuvering where a startup inhabits a shell company that's already publicly listed. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Spartan Energy, the leading candidate to be Fisker's blank check company, jumped as much as 71% over two trading sessions, even though Fisker hasn’t actually committed to going public yet. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But don’t forget about the big boy</strong>: One look at Tesla’s skyrocketing share price shows it's still squarely in the EV driver seat. It hopes to release its Cybertruck by late 2021.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No one cares what you wear when everyone is WFHing. But these headlines show that some apparel decisions are getting out of control. Three of these wonky stories are real while one is fake. Can you spot the knockoff? </p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDisney's Looking for That Reopening Magic\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Disney World reopening \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjc1L2Rpc25leV93b3JsZF9yZW9wZW5pbmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eROBYN BECK/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’ve been as guilty as anyone in using the term “New Normal” to describe the resumption of daily life during the pandemic. But you have to admit it \u003cem\u003eis\u003c/em\u003e the perfect phrase for today’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/09/disney-reopening-this-week-even-as-coronavirus-cases-spike-in-florida.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereopening\u003c/a\u003e of Walt Disney World in Orlando. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDisney World open = normal\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDisney World open but everyone’s in masks and you can’t hug Mickey = new normal. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eMagic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom will reopen today, with Epcot and Hollywood Studios set to greet visitors July 15.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDisney is actually \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/08/business/coronavirus-disney-world-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot the first\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of the FL parks to come back. SeaWorld is open, and Universal’s three parks opened up June 5 with limited capacity.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDisney has also reopened four theme parks in Asia.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe Dumbo in the room\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you think it’s an odd time to open up a theme park for thousands of strangers to mingle together, most wouldn’t disagree with you. COVID-19 cases have surged in Florida, where the park is located, and ICU beds are now \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/health/2020/07/09/coronavirus-florida-nearly-half-states-icus-least-90-full/5409773002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eat a premium\u003c/a\u003e. Health officials say the curve is not flat.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHowever, Disney thinks it can open the park in a safe way that protects staff and visitors. Its safety protocols, which have been signed by a union representing roughly 48,000 employees, call for mandatory mask wearing, thousands of hand-sanitation stations, empty seats on rides, \u003ca href=\"https://disneyparks.disney.go.com/blog/2020/07/disney-parks-commitment-to-health-safety-measures/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eand more\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe financial impact \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor Disney, opening up Disney World isn’t really something it wants rather than \u003cem\u003eneeds\u003c/em\u003e. The theme park’s contribution to the company’s top line is staggering:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMedia analyst Michael Nathanson told CNN Business that Disney World \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/09/media/disney-world-reopening/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egenerated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 16% of Disney’s total revenue in 2019—$11.2 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe broader theme parks segment is also an important profit-driver for the company, allowing it to invest in new products that may not make money right away.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose new investments were a life-saver during the pandemic. We’re talking about Disney+, of course, which just enjoyed a \u003cem\u003eHamilton\u003c/em\u003e-sized weekend over the Fourth of July. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eDisney World is the sun breathing life into the entire Disney ecosystem. The company is desperate to get it open. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSupermarket staple Goya Foods is facing loads of backlash and a \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2020/07/10/goya-boycott-trump/?utm_campaign=wp_main\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_source=facebook\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" Trump’s leadership in a joint appearance Thursday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt a ceremony marking the president’s executive order to Fisker\u003c/strong\u003e, another young electric automaker, is reportedly in talks to go public via a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-spartan-energy-m-a-fisker/fisker-the-latest-electric-car-maker-eyeing-deal-to-go-public-sources-idUSKBN24A2HZ?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblank check acquisition company\u003c/a\u003e”—a bit of financial maneuvering where a startup inhabits a shell company that's already publicly listed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpartan Energy, the leading candidate to be Fisker's blank check company, jumped as much as 71% over two trading sessions, even though Fisker hasn’t actually committed to going public yet. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut don’t forget about the big boy\u003c/strong\u003e: One look at Tesla’s skyrocketing share price shows it's still squarely in the EV driver seat.
